meanings.sent1: The invention of the wheel antedates modern technology.
meanings.sent2: The dinosaurs antedate humans by millions of years.
meanings.sent3: The idea of flying cars antedates the reality of self-driving cars.
meanings.sent4: His wisdom antedates his years, making him seem older than he is.
meanings.sent5: The ancient ruins antedate any known civilization, leaving historians puzzled.

meanings.definition: To assign to an earlier date.
meanings.sent1: She mistakenly antedated the letter, causing confusion.
meanings.sent2: The historian antedated the manuscript to the 15th century.
meanings.sent3: The student tried to antedate his homework to avoid a late penalty.
meanings.sent4: The artist's signature was antedated, raising doubts about the painting's authenticity.
meanings.sent5: The archaeologist antedated the pottery shards to the Bronze Age, reshaping our understanding of the era.

meanings.sent1: The ancient civilization antedates the rise of the Roman Empire.
meanings.sent2: The legend of King Arthur antedates written records.
meanings.sent3: The joke about the chicken crossing the road antedates the internet.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness antedates any expectation, making her stand out in a crowd.
meanings.sent5: The folklore antedates the establishment of the town, adding to its mysterious charm.
